In multiparty systems like Spain’s, understanding how major parties adjust their platforms in response to shifting public opinion is crucial. The MVT predicts that, over time, main parties tend to converge towards the median voter’s preferences in order to maximize support. This allows me to interpret not just raw poll numbers, but also underlying strategic shifts and structural incentives that might affect polling trends over time.
